intro: Tetragonia purpurea, commonly known as the purple spinach or New Zealand spinach, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, edible leaves that are often used in culinary applications. The plant features a sprawling growth habit with fleshy, lobed leaves that range in color from green to purple, depending on the variety. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by capsule fruits containing tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Tetragonia purpurea is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure.
